result.execSummary:
The defendant Jody L. Moore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-False Representation <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Price County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.descr: Amended Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt: 10:02 am - DA calls case and states appearances.  Defendant Jody L. Moore not in court.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jail has submitted a letter requesting 6.7 days of sentence credit.  So ordered.
Order approving request for furlough at discretion of jail for release and return times

10:31 am - 14CF45, 15CF33 - Defendant Jody L. Moore appeared with attorney Karl J. Kelz.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. No objection to Judge Knox-Bauer handling 15CF33.  Parties have received and reviewed revocation packet. DA certifies victims rights compliance. Comments and recommendation by DA. Comments and recommendation by Atty. Kelz. Comments by defendant. Comments by L. Linden. Comments and ruling by Court. Appeal rights given. Adj. 10:46 am. 
Court imposes:

14CF45 (Ct. 2):  45 day jail term, with huber privileges, cs to 15CF33, with 30 days credit for time served; Reimpose prior monetary obligations reducing to civil judgment

15CF33 (Ct. 1): 6 month jail term, with huber privileges, cs to 14CF45, with credit for 62 days time served; Reimpose prior monetary obligations reducing to civil judgment
Sentencing hearing on revocation on April 8, 2016 at 11:00 am.

10:07 am - 14CF45, 14CF57, 15CF33, 15CM56 & Taylor Co. 15CM7 - Defendant Jody L. Moore appeared with attorney Daniel Francis Snyder.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DA states agreement. DA certifies victim rights compliance. DA moves to amend Ct. 2 in 14CF45 to 961.574(1) and Ct. 1 in 15CF33 to 943.20(1)(d).  So ordered.  DE pleads NO CONTEST to Ct. 2 in 14CF45, Ct. 2 in 14CF57, Ct. 1 in 15CF33.    Court questions DE regarding the plea, plea questionnaire, elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts pleas, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC on Ct. 1 in 15CF33, Ct. 2 in 14CF45, Ct. 2 in 14CF57 and on motion of DA dismisses and reads in Ct. 1 in 14CF45, Ct. 1 in 14CF57 and dismisses and reads in 15CM56 for purposes of ordering repayment of service fees and dismisses and reads in Taylor Co. case 15CM7. Comments by DA. Comments by L. Linden. Comments by C. Linden. Comments by Atty. Snyder. Ruling by Court. Appeal rights given. Adj. 10:53 am. 
Court imposes:

14CF45 (Ct. 2): Sentence withheld - 1 year probation.
Conditions:
30 day jail term, with huber privileges, may be served in any county, to commence no later than 10-17-15 @ 4:30 pm, concurrent to Ct. 2 in 14CF57
AODA
$500 fine
$45 SBDA
Contraband evidence to be destroyed after appeal time limits

14CF57 (Ct. 2): Sentence withheld - 3 year probation.
Conditions:
30 day jail term, with huber privileges, may be served in any county, to commence no later than 10-17-15 @ 4:30 pm
Apology
$500 fine
$250 DNAAS & sample
Restitution to be determined, hearing to be requested within 30 days from today, if no objection amend JOC to reflect Restitution, J&S $14,930 + 10% surcharge
Taylor Co. 15CM7 dismissed and read in.  If there is any restitution owed DA is to file form within 30 days and if there is objection a hearing shall be requested within another 30 days.

15CF33 (Ct. 1): Sentence withheld - 1 year probation.
Conditions:
$243 court costs
$200 DNAAS & sample
$75 SBDA
$75 SBDA from read-in 15CM56

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release. Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.  DE may not have contact with Charles Linden, unless there is written consent on file.

15CM56 & 15CF33 - Defendant Jody L. Moore appeared with attorney Daniel Francis Snyder.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.  Preliminary hearing requested, time limits waived.  Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled.  DE enters plea of NOT GUILTY to Misd. counts. One bond both cases.
